turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Human multitasking.
turn.1: What are the different modes of multitasking?
turn.2: According to studies by the Kaiser Family Foundation, in 1999 only 16 percent of time spent using media such as Internet, television, video games, telephones, text-messaging, or e-mail was combined.
turn.4: In 2005, 26 percent of the time these media were used together.
turn.6: This increase in simultaneous media usage decreases the amount of attention paid to each device.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: In 2005 it was found that 82 percent of American youth use the Internet by the seventh grade in school.
turn.9: what else did it result in?
turn.10: A 2005 survey by the Kaiser Family Foundation found that, while their usage of media continued at a constant 6.5 hours per day, Americans ages 8 to 18 were crowding roughly 8.5 hours’ worth of media into their days due to multitasking.
turn.11: what else did the survey show?
turn.12: The survey showed that one quarter to one-third of the participants have more than one input “most of the time” while watching television, listening to music, or reading.
